nodes.label: Watson
nodes.description: Watson is the tool to track content-related Deals, Contracts, & Options. It provides company-wide visibility and standardization of tracking content-related deal negotiations across all buying teams.

nodes.label: Gravity
nodes.description: Gravity provides functionality to create budgets and forecasts for content spend and creates slugs to be filled in as we define our Programming slate.

nodes.label: Prequel
nodes.description: Prequel is used to track pitches & submissions accessible by the Buying / Creative teams and their various partners they include for the consideration process. It's also used to track talent we may consider for future projects.

nodes.label: Orion
nodes.description: A programming tool that helps CS&A and Creatives determine the ideal programming schedule. Orion Helps us Visualize the Information Coming from Gravity

nodes.label: Moneyball
nodes.description: Moneyball is a financial application which the Content Accounting team uses to manage the accounting related to producing and licensing content for Netflix.

nodes.label: Production Finance Hub
nodes.description: Budgets Insights navigation bar making it easy to move between these modules for a given title.  share a common ,  Cash   Flow , and

nodes.label: Rights
nodes.description: Rights allows Netflix to define and understand what we own, can exhibit, purchased (Rights In) or sold, and sub-licensed (Rights Out) for both Content and Music.

nodes.label: Talent Finance
nodes.description: Talent Finance is the tool the Contingent Compensation team uses to track, facilitate, and interpret Talent Finance deal terms.

nodes.label: Songbird
nodes.description: A unified music product for the studio side of Netflix.

nodes.label: Residuals
nodes.description: Residuals is the tool the Residuals Team uses to setup and facilitate mandated payments to Hollywood Unions (i.e., guilds) based on how we exploit content on our service.

nodes.label: Amadeus
nodes.description: Amadeus calculates and manages music payments and accruals to collection societies and provides critical payment workflows.

nodes.label: Slate Manager
nodes.description: Slate Manager consolidates the details of how we produce our content, into a single streamlined experience.

nodes.label: Production Center
nodes.description: Production Center is our external facing application that helps streamline Production office workflows, aid in file delivery and collaboration with the studio.

nodes.label: Netflix Production Manual
nodes.description: Netflix Production Manual is your Production’s resource for guidelines on producing content for Netflix Owned Originals globally.

nodes.label: Netflix VFX Shotgrid
nodes.description: Shotgrid Software makes project management and pipeline tools that help creative studios track, schedule, review, collaborate, and manage their digital assets.

nodes.label: Netflix Studio Account
nodes.description: The Netflix Studio Account is our partners's gateway to access the Netflix Studio tools they use when working with Netflix.

nodes.label: Starship
nodes.description: Starship is a self-service administrative tool that grants authorization throughout the Netflix app ecosystem.

nodes.label: Hubble
nodes.description: Hubble is a centralized portal for Talent across all Netflix internal applications. Its features include Talent search, discovery the ability to export lists of Talent.

nodes.label: Vendor HQ
nodes.description: Vendor HQ is a vendor management tool designed to simplify the discovery, onboarding, and management of vendors who work with Netflix.

nodes.label: Workstation Manager
nodes.description: UI that allows users to access remote workstations pre- configured with software. In some cases are connected to Netflix-built pipelines for media exchanges.

nodes.label: NetFX
nodes.description: The NetFX Platform is a combination of hardware, software, compute, render, storage, pipeline, and operations that all comes together to enable artists to complete visual effects work.

nodes.label: Talent Hub
nodes.description: The Talent Hub is an Airtable solution that seeks to improve title management decision- making around the selection of Talent while mitigating risks when crewing across regions within highly compressed markets.

nodes.label: Asset Spotting
nodes.description: Asset Spotting supports the editorial process by providing a centralized place to list and identify assets within an animatic and generate breakdown lists.

nodes.label: Content Hub
nodes.description: Content Hub is a central, secure place to store and share media. This is where our partners deliver assets for archival as well as in-progress assets (liked a locked cut) to Netflix, so downstream teams can begin their work.

nodes.label: Partner Delivery
nodes.description: Partner Delivery gets content to and from ShotGrid to vendors via Content Hub.

nodes.label: Animation Connect
nodes.description: Animation Connect is a marketplace for our talent and shows. Our goal is to create a universe where NAS talent can build a community off their creations and discover exciting opportunities to grow within Netflix.

nodes.label: Edit Bay
nodes.description: Edit Bay is the hub for tracking, managing, and sharing editorial cuts in Animation.

nodes.label: Asset QC
nodes.description: The Netflix quality control platform for the evaluation of content assets at scale.

nodes.label: AVA
nodes.description: AVA allows users to select frame-specific stills directly from the viewable, but will also suggest candidate frames.

nodes.label: Backlot
nodes.description: A suite of tools and services to order, deliver, and manage video, audio, and text content assets for the Netflix product.

nodes.label: Content Localization Portal
nodes.description: The CL Portal is a project management application designed to house all apps and pieces of the dub process. Tools include Script Authoring, Dub Talent List & Casting Approval

nodes.label: Authoring Tool
nodes.description: Dub script authoring allows Netflix partners to transcribe, translate, tag annotations, and provide frame accurate dialog events as the base foundation in which dubs will be created.

nodes.label: Dub Talent List
nodes.description: Dub Talent List is a lightweight application used for the streamlined creation of a dub talent list.

nodes.label: Partner Information Portal
nodes.description: PIP is a Wiki collection of our Dubbing Partners data. It allows our partners to enter and update their information in a self-serve manner.

nodes.label: Grand Bazaar
nodes.description: Grand Bazaar is a proprietary bidding tool used to capture localization costs for Netflix content.

nodes.label: Originator
nodes.description: Originator is the tool through which timed text assets going through through Direct-Timed-Text (DTT) are created.

nodes.label: Clips
nodes.description: Clips can be used by external partners, agencies, and internal Netflix employees to clip and pull footage from long form content for the purposes of creating trailers, hooks, teasers etc.

nodes.label: Terminology
nodes.description: The Key Names and Phrases (KNP) tool helps ensure consistency in terminology across the different localized assets (synopses, trailers, subtitles, dubbed audio, and forced narratives) of Netflix titles.

nodes.label: Title Localization
nodes.description: Title Localization (a.k.a. Tiloc) is for managing localization of series and standalone titles.

nodes.label: Lucid
nodes.description: Lucid is our task and translation management platform. Its suite includes: KNP , Glossary Management and TM Explorer.

nodes.label: CCM
nodes.description: An information and project management system designed to remove reliance on siloed tools as part of our daily workflows, increase visibility across the organization, and connect Marketing assets across the globe.

nodes.label: Lex
nodes.description: LEX is a data tool for text- based promotional assets, in other words, it is a multi- dimensional dashboard that allows users to track several performance metrics to understand how a candidate suite of synopses for a specific title did.

nodes.label: Dexter
nodes.description: Dexter allows for flexible routes to setup content and distribute metadata to the product to support A/B tests and other use cases.

nodes.label: Application Loc Hub
nodes.description: Application Localization Hub (fka Obelix) is a string repository that manages, serves, and processes translation of all UI strings. This is primarily a developer- facing product.

nodes.label: Loc Reference Tool
nodes.description: Localization Reference Tool is an aggregate of information cards pulled from other internal tools to provide context for localization.

nodes.label: Grand Arcade
nodes.description: A tool to help “buyers” from product and marketing track costs and overages when working with agencies during the conceptual phase of a/v, artwork, etc.

nodes.label: Muse
nodes.description: Asset level performance insights to help analyze title performance and inform future design strategies.

nodes.label: Serenity
nodes.description: Serenity is a streamlined video asset localization and assembly tool.

nodes.label: Planning & Ordering Portal
nodes.description: The Planning & Ordering Portal (POP) creates centralized visibility into the assets that are planned for a campaign, provides a way to order localized versions of those assets, and consolidates links to final assets & source files.

nodes.label: Iris
nodes.description: Iris houses artwork for all titles on service. It provides direct access to artwork allows users to associate associate artwork assets with MIDs, Languages, Countries, etc.

nodes.label: Artwork Portal
nodes.description: An Artwork fulfillment and QC tool that enables users to request Originals artwork assets for Conceptual, Production and Marketing project types.

nodes.label: MUT
nodes.description: The app for generating Netflix mockups. A library of every screen on every Netflix app on every device (TV, Web, iPhone and Android).

nodes.label: VanDAM
nodes.description: VanDAM is a proprietary digital asset management system utilized by over 1,200 monthly users across Creative Production, Marketing, Comms, and external partners.

nodes.label: PAL
nodes.description: PAL is the centralized platform for discovering, searching, and sharing final promotional assets created by Product and Marketing teams.

nodes.label: Creative Review
nodes.description: Creative Review is an app for reviewing, finishing, and approving creative. Creative review was built for all marketing teams, product teams, and their agencies.

nodes.label: Media Center
nodes.description: Media Center enables journalists and media critics to easily discover news about our company and to independently access information about Netflix titles.

nodes.label: Marketing Email Maker
nodes.description: Marketing Email Maker is a tool that allows you to create bespoke Netflix-branded emails for Creative Marketing and Publicity teams to send internally or externally for debuts and other press outreach.

nodes.label: Socialite
nodes.description: A distribution planning application for social content that allows teams across all of MarComms to collaborate on social campaigns.

nodes.label: Newsroom
nodes.description: The Newsroom houses all Netflix announcements about content, product, business, our social impact work and beyond.

nodes.label: Tudum CMS
nodes.description: The Tudum CMS in Contentful powers the Tudum experience that consumers see. It houses all of the site’s editorial content that is not dynamically populated from the Product, and it is where teams work to assemble that content.

nodes.label: Marcomms HQ
nodes.description: MarC aggregates and summarizes key information about campaign plans from the apps that MarComms already uses. Now you can easily view a summary of campaign plans across markets and teams. omms HQ is a dashboard that

nodes.label: Campaign Admin
nodes.description: Campaign Admin is a marketing app used to generate and search for Marketing Campaign IDs for use in all non-single title campaigns.

nodes.label: Title Insights
nodes.description: Title-level information and metrics about how content is performing post it's launch.

nodes.label: Hopper
nodes.description: A tool used by our Content Protection team to support semi- automatic fingerprint generation and copyright enforcement across UGC platforms

nodes.label: Content Preview
nodes.description: Content Preview allows internal users to provision access to content and promotional experiences for on-service QA or pre-release screenings.

nodes.label: Athena
nodes.description: Generates predictions that are indicative of popularity for title(s) using a knowledge base of connected metadata. AKA creates the 28DW and AVS Metrics

nodes.label: NTV
nodes.description: NTV (or Netflix Title Visibility) is a view-only application that gives high-level information into the launch readiness of a given title as well as how it will appear on our service in different countries around the world.

nodes.label: Metadata UI
nodes.description: Tool used to edit and manage title related metadata (Tier/Originals Flags).

nodes.label: Ratings UI
nodes.description: Ratings UI is the source of truth & one-stop shop for all things Ratings within the ecosystem.

nodes.label: Graffiti
nodes.description: Graffiti is an editorial metadata management tool designed to enhance content learning and insights. It supports various tagging workflows, including time- based tagging, human-in-the- loop algorithm classification, and self-serve tag minting

nodes.label: Turbo
nodes.description: Turbo is an app to create and manage Collections. Collections are groups of titles that are somehow related.

nodes.label: CC UI
nodes.description: Content Catalog UI aims to centralize asset metadata, experience and scheduling tasks in one application, significantly streamlining title experience management.

nodes.label: Metadata Fulfillment UI
nodes.description: Allows vendors and content teams to manage a subset of editorial tags for our content in a secure and streamlined manner.

nodes.label: Nutshell
nodes.description: Nutshell is where writers create synopses in English for every title on the service, plus support A/B testing.
